episodeTitle: The Ordeal of Spheres! Desperate Struggle in the Lost Forest!
description: Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp face Satori, one of Enel's priests, in the Ordeal of Balls. Satori uses his Mantra abilities and explosive surprise clouds to overwhelm the trio. Meanwhile, Chopper encounters Priest Shura at the Going Merry and desperately calls for Gan Fall's help.

events.title: Aisa's Debut
events.description: Aisa, a young Shandia girl, appears for the first time gathering soil in Upper Yard. She possesses the rare ability of Mantra (Observation Haki) despite her young age.
events.significance: Introduces Aisa, the youngest character shown to possess Observation Haki naturally. Her ability to sense life force becomes important later in the arc.

events.title: Ordeal of Balls Continues
events.description: Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp continue their desperate battle against Priest Satori in the Lost Forest. The Little Crow ship drifts deeper into the forest as they struggle.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power of Enel's priests and the mysterious Mantra ability that allows Satori to predict all their moves.

quotes.text: Ho ho ho! With my Mantra, I can see all your moves before you make them!
quotes.speaker: Satori
quotes.context: Satori explaining his ability to predict the Straw Hats' attacks

events.title: Satori Demonstrates Mantra Mastery
events.description: Satori showcases his complete mastery of Mantra, effortlessly dodging and predicting every attack from Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp. His mind-reading ability proves nearly impossible to overcome.
events.significance: First detailed demonstration of Mantra's full capabilities in combat. This ability will later be revealed as Observation Haki, one of the three types of Haki.

events.title: Impact Dial Attack
events.description: Satori uses an Impact Dial to deliver a devastating internal attack to Sanji, demonstrating another dangerous weapon in the priests' arsenal. The attack bypasses external defenses to damage internal organs.
events.significance: Introduces Impact Dials, one of the unique Sky Island technologies that absorb and release impact force. This technology becomes important throughout the arc.

quotes.text: This is the power of the Impact Dial!
quotes.speaker: Satori
quotes.context: Satori revealing his Impact Dial attack on Sanji

events.title: Surprise Clouds Explained
events.description: Satori's Surprise Clouds (Bikkuri Tama) are shown to contain various unpredictable contents - from harmless flowers and birds to deadly snakes and explosives. The identical appearance makes them impossible to distinguish.
events.significance: Demonstrates the creative and unpredictable nature of Sky Island combat technology, adding an element of chance to the Ordeal of Balls.

events.title: Chopper Encounters Sky Shark
events.description: While searching for a dropped hammer, Chopper encounters a dangerous sky shark in the White Sea surrounding Upper Yard. He's thrown back to the Going Merry.
events.significance: Shows the dangerous wildlife of Skypiea and sets up Chopper's isolation on the ship before Shura's arrival.

events.title: Chopper Finds the Whistle
events.description: Back on the Going Merry, Chopper discovers the whistle that Gan Fall gave them earlier, which can be used to summon the Sky Knight in times of need.
events.significance: Sets up Chopper's ability to call for help when Shura arrives. The whistle becomes crucial in the next episode's battle.

events.title: Shura Arrives at Going Merry
events.description: Priest Shura, riding his giant bird Fuza, arrives at the Going Merry where Chopper is alone. Shura questions why there's only one sacrifice to kill, establishing himself as Chopper's opponent.
events.significance: Introduces Shura, the priest of the Ordeal of String with a 3% survival rate. Sets up the next episode's battle between Chopper, Gan Fall, and Shura.

quotes.text: Why is there only one sacrifice here?
quotes.speaker: Shura
quotes.context: Shura's first words upon arriving at the Going Merry

events.title: Chopper Blows the Whistle
events.description: Faced with the terrifying Priest Shura, Chopper desperately blows the whistle to summon Gan Fall for help, using his last resort to protect the ship.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's resourcefulness and sets up Gan Fall's timely arrival in the next episode. Demonstrates Chopper's dedication to protecting the Going Merry.

quotes.speaker: Satori

quotes.speaker: Satori

quotes.text: Why is there only one sacrifice here?
quotes.speaker: Shura
quotes.context: Arriving at the Going Merry to find only Chopper

themes.description: The Straw Hats face enemies whose abilities seem impossible to overcome, testing their determination and creativity.
themes.symbolism: Satori's Mantra represents the seemingly insurmountable challenges the crew must face in Skypiea.

themes.description: The crew is split up across Upper Yard, with each group facing their own trials. Chopper's isolation on the ship makes him particularly vulnerable.
themes.symbolism: The separation of the crew shows how they must sometimes face challenges individually before coming together.

themes.description: The Sky Island technology like Impact Dials and Surprise Clouds represents the strange new world the Straw Hats must learn to navigate.
themes.symbolism: The unpredictable nature of the Surprise Clouds mirrors the unpredictable dangers of Upper Yard.

characterSpotlights.development: Satori demonstrates why he is one of Enel's four priests, showcasing overwhelming power through Mantra and various Sky Island weapons.
keyActions: Predicts all attacks from Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp using Mantra
Uses Impact Dial to severely damage Sanji
Controls the battlefield with Surprise Clouds
quotes: Ho ho ho! With my Mantra, I can see all your moves before you make them!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper is left alone to protect the Going Merry and must face the arrival of Priest Shura, showing his courage despite overwhelming fear.
keyActions: Encounters sky shark while searching for hammer
Finds and recognizes the importance of Gan Fall's whistle
Desperately calls for help when Shura arrives

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy struggles against an enemy who can predict his every move, forcing him to think beyond his usual straightforward fighting style.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle with Satori compared to the manga, showing more individual attack attempts from each Straw Hat.
The sky shark encounter with Chopper is expanded in the anime to add more tension before Shura's arrival.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Aisa, who is the youngest character in the series shown to naturally possess Observation Haki (Mantra).
The Impact Dial introduced in this episode becomes an important tool later used by several characters, including Usopp.
Satori's Ordeal of Balls has a 10% survival rate, making it the second-most survivable ordeal after Ohm's Ordeal of Iron at 0%.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Usopp and Sanji, reflecting their prominent role in the battle against Satori.
The episode had a TV rating of 10.1% and ranked #8 when it originally aired in Japan on July 20, 2003.
